alert.note: Alert for Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Randolph County through 645 PM EDT... At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Thomasville, or 11 miles west of Asheboro, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... High Point, Asheboro, Randleman, North Carolina Zoo, Archdale, Trinity, Liberty, Ramseur, Franklinville and Staley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
